data: Herman L.  Verlinde Herman L.  Verlinde Professor of Physics Department Chair 609-258-5585 verlinde@Princeton.EDU 350 Jadwin Hall physics.princeton.edu/~verlinde/ My research field is string theory. I am interested in all its many aspects: its mathematical foundations and non-perturbative formulations, as well as its applications to particle physics, gauge theory, black hole physics, and cosmology. The focus of my most recent research is the quantum theory of black hole horizons, and its connection to quantum information theory and entanglement.
